events.message: The insured reported a car accident involving rear-end collision with another vehicle on the highway.
Claim assessed and categorised under Auto Accident based on keywords and incident details provided.
An agent with expertise in vehicle collision claims was assigned promptly to manage the customerâ€™s case.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment letter confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
Request sent to the claimant for the vehicle inspection report, police report, and photos of the accident scene.
Customer promptly submitted all requested documents including the official police report and repair estimate.
An investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence to validate the claim and assess damages.
Investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault, and damages were verified by the experts.
A settlement proposal covering full vehicle repair costs was sent to the customer for review and approval.
Customer responded positively indicating satisfaction with the proposed settlement and prompt handling.
Claim officially approved by the claims manager following customer acceptance of the settlement terms.
Insurance payment was issued electronically to the claimant for repair costs as per settlement agreement.
The insurance claim was closed successfully after confirming payment receipt and customer satisfaction.
